highlights: Compiling data, literature review and theoretical calculations for a manuscript in preparation[cite: 29].
Executing cycling-EIS-DRT tests to investigate Li/LLZO interface. [cite_start]Designing custom 3-electrode Li-ion cells[cite: 30].

work.name: IISER, Mohali
highlights: Isolated the stabilisation effect of weak F-bonding in fluorinated sp2 molecules by modelling CF- interactions using Gaussian09 on real molecules from the Cambridge Structural Database[cite: 32].

work.name: Indian Institute of Science Bangalore
work.summary: Acoustic and impedance analysis of solid electrolytes[cite: 33].
highlights: Established a broad-band EIS-DRT setup for solid electrolytes (LLZO, LPSCI), leading to quantifiable improvements in interfacial stability in half-cell and bilayer configurations[cite: 35].

Evaluated improvements to LLZO synthesis using DRT, demonstrating limitations to achieving high density LLZO and highlighting the critical role of grain-boundary phases in bulk and interfacial electro-mechanics[cite: 36].
Conducted theoretical and experimental investigations into probe design for acoustic analysis of solid-state cells[cite: 37].

work.name: Max Planck Institute für Eisenforschung, Düsseldorf
highlights: Unravelled the role of iron in bimetallic Ni-Fe catalysts for the Oxygen Evolution Reaction (OER) by study design and systematic physical (XPS) and electrochemical (CP) characterisation, subsequently coupling both via operando Raman spectroscopy[cite: 42].

work.name: Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore
highlights: Engineered hermetically sealing polymeric chambers through material simulation and iterative design and testing, enabling the first low-temperature charge transport measurements on mixed ionic-electronic organic transistors in an aqueous environment[cite: 46].
Fabricated and electrochemically characterised Organic Electrochemical Transistors on interdigitated electrodes[cite: 47].

work.name: Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
highlights: Reading project with simulation work to set up the pseudo-2D model in COMSOL Multiphysics for calculating capacity loss in Li-ion cells based on SEI growth towards a large-model study[cite: 49].
